text:
Delicious, fragrant, a solid Imperial IPA. Visits with Bill enabled the tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid beer as always from Maine, but again they dont pop for me. Maybe the yeast, maybe the water? I dont know. Its a highly competent DIPA, nothing more.

Huge thanks to johnnnniee for this hard-to-get beer. In the landscape of Imperial IPAs, there are many that can be called intriguing, but only a select few can truly be described as beautiful. Maine Beer Dinner is one of those few. Yellow-orange pour with lots of haze, head, and lacing. Tropical and piney nose - bright with zest and resin. Grapefruit, pineapple, orange, melon, and tangerine flavors. Some pine, too. Lots of juicy fruit flavors yet very little bitterness. Bone dry finish. This is like an East coast Pliny the Elder. Its perfect.

Bottle.

A- Orange marmalade, dreamsicle bar.

A- Golden orange color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Orange juice, mild bitterness, dreamsicle ice cream.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- This very well may top Pliny and Hopslam. Certainly doesnt feel like a DIPA. Drinks too easily and loaded with orange flavors. Good stuff. Had a month after bottling.Was great at Dinner with some sausage, kale, and white bean soup.
Gold pour 2 fingers of head, loads of lace. Can i just say citrus for aroma and taste and be done with it. No. ok, citrus forward, tangerine sweetness, grassy, sweet malt. Medium body.
(Bouteille partagée par Nick & Frances):Je suis surpris de ne pas lavoir raté, on va remédier à ça. Crème de citron et orange avec des malts machable et adéquatement sucrée.

Bottled version. Pours out a super cloudy opaque orange. Frothy off-white head becomes a thick foamy lace. Huge citrus-pine-fruit aromas. Texture is soft. Flavor is complex mix of juicy citrus, pine and tropical fruit with a hint of spice. Dry bready backbone. Very fresh.

Pours a very hazy, yellow-orange, not unlike fresh-squeezed orange juice. Minimal head. Aroma full of citrus and tropical fruits, with more than a little hop presence as well. Flavor is very smooth and well balanced, with citrus (grapefruit) and tropical notes, as well as some hoppy bitterness. But its not too bitter--theres a sweet finish and soft mouthfeel to the whole enterprise. Very, very good beer.

Bottle sample at Beer Study bottle share in Durham. wow, thanks to whoever brought this. Hazy golden color. Nice aroma of pineapple, tropical fruit, citrus, light pine. taste is nicely balanced bittersweet resiny mixed summer fruit. delicious.

Bottle, shared at a tasting in Tokyo on 1/8/17. Bottled 11/12/16. Hazy yellow to golden color. White head, dense, but also a bit frothy. Aromas: citrus and malty sweetness. Flavor is moderate bitter with some hoppy sourness, herbal. Medium bodied. Finish is moderate to full bitter. Delicious.
Hazy golden amber color. Mint and mandarin oranges, a bit of warming at the finish. Very dank. Medium bitterness. Just well put together. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours a murky yellow with thin white head. Citrus aroma and bIg hop flavor but pretty balanced and no alcohol taste though it is a high ABV. Probably the best DIPA I can remember having.
From a 50 cl. Bottle. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Aroma of juicy citrus and pine, Flavors of spruce, grapefruit and melon. Fabulous, with a moderately bitter finsh.

Bottle thanks to Rob. Pours a cloudy orange gold with small frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit; mango, tangerine, orange peel, and pine. Medium body, juicy hop, dank, grapefruit pith, tangerine, light bitter finish, really enjoyed this.

Bottle poured into snifter showing hazy orange and sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a strong and very clean citrus forwardness with notes of blood orange and tangerine. 

The palate is medium bodied and fully carbonated. Strong and juicy flavors of blood orange and tangerine with citrus notes in between that transitions into a smooth but strong pine IPA bitterness. Supported by a strong malt backbone throughout. Superb IIPA.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of pine, mango, peach, pineapple, crisp hops and citrus. Taste of pine, crisp hops, citrus, orange, slight tropical notes and weak herbs. This is about 40 days old and keeps up pretty good.

From bottle thanks to Matt Kennedy at Dangerous Bottleshares Lit Af Edition. Pours a hazy orangy golden with a medium sized, white head. Aroma is super fruity with passion fruit, pineapple, mango, citrus, slight caramel malts, dank, piny. Taste has a hoppy, minty spice, lots of juicy fruits, light caramel sweetness, medium bitter finish. Average carbonation and a smooth, slight oily body. Nice, but doesnt stand out a whole lot.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares Lit AF edition. Pours light hazy light orange with a small white head. Aromas of fresh herbal hops, grapefruit, orange, citrus, pineapple, subtle malt, orange, pine. Taste is piney, grapefruity, caramel, malt, light dankness, orange, citrus.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares "Lit AF" edition. Light hazy orangish pour with a small frothy head. Notes og juicy hops, light pine sap, light sweetness, light floral, grapefruit and some citrus peel.

Drunk at OEC carpark, tastings, on my last US trip.

Lots of pine and pith. Hop pallets in a glass. Raw onion upfront. Plenty of hop resin and late bitterness. Assertive whack of IBUs. Bitter and uncompromising. Exactly what I came to experience on trademark East Coast modern IPAs. A bit one-dimensional but its still good.

September 29, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of rlgk, thanks! 
Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, light malty and dank notes with grapefruit, orange, mango, pineapple, grass, pine, biscuit. Taste is light to medium sweet, smooth bitterness. Finish is a light sweet biscuit base with some sweet pineapple, green pawpaw notes, bitter grass and pine notes with some citrus zest notes. Medium bodied, smooth carbonation. 
Very smooth and easy drinkable.
Dark gold. Bitter. Citrus. Piney. Dry. Reminds me of a juicier pliny. Shared w tony b at shaw park. Thx thepatrickman for this surprise.
A: Light yellow coloured with a one finger white head. N: Pine, oak, light citrus, hint of hay, diesel T: Pine, citrus, fruity O: Very well balanced! Nice!

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy tiny burnt yellow with a small frothy white head that leaves some stick lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is tiny malty, tiny fruity and slightly grassy with crackers, crisp bread, grilled grapefruit, unripe mango, moist grass, pine needles, minerals, orange zest, lemon zest and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, tiny malty and grassy. Mouthfeel is round, very tiny viscous, tiny astringent, very tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with crackers, bread, grapefruit, moist grass, pine needles, minerals, lemon zest and hints of alcohol and diesel fuel. Very well executed classic IIPA. In no way a fruit bomb but plenty of grass and grilled grapefruit. Nice!

At Dinner tasting 160912. Thanks Joe. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus aroma, caramel, grapes, citrus, hay, floral, biscuits, oranges, some peach. Hoppy citrus and caramel flavor, herbal, hay, oranges, well hidden alcohol. Well balanced and very drinkable.

Pours cloudy pale amber golden with a small head. Aroma is fruity very citric hoppy tropical fruits. Flavor is fullbodied malty happy fruity slightly sweet nicely bitter, well balanced with all of its components. A treat.
Im not usually an IPA fan but this one is actually quite good. Its much more palatable than anything Ive had outside of treehouse or the like. Maine is doing very well with this one.

Fresh ass bottle. Cloudy light yellow pour with a white head. Enticing apricot bouquet. Wow, impressive. Big apricot and nectarine flavors. There is a hoppy bitterness but its secondary to the stone fruits. Good balance with plenty of caramel malts. Good body and mouthfeel.

500 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewed 8/13/2014.
Hazy orange body. Nice white head. A bit of lacing and a medium collar.

Smell has tons of mango and tropical fruit. Orange hops. Lightly toasted malt. 

Tastes of bright orange hops. More orange than tropical fruit, but both are present. Some sweet pale malts and some cracker malt. Mild mustiness and hop bitterness.

Medium body. Great balance of sweetness and mild bitterness. Medium carbonation.
Well this is just fantastic. Its a hop bomb but the malt profile is balanced very well.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a super murky pale yellow with white head. Tons of lacing. Aroma is big time tropical fruit with pineapple, melon, some orange, peach. Taste is an incredibly well balanced fruity bitterness. Flavors similar to the nose of tropical and citrus fruits along with some caramel. Top Notch IPA. Easily one of the best I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle via non-Ratebeer trade. Bottled 032616. Cloudy gold with a short white head. Aroma is strong floral hops, tropical fruit, hop resins and pine. Taste is big fruit notes, pine, floral hops and resinous notes. Body is medium with a soft bubbly carbonation and a light lingering hop bitterness. Ends with more floral hops, tropical fruit, citrus notes and sweet malt. Very nice!

Bottle courtesy of BA trade. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is citrus, peach, apricot, and lemon with grass. Flavor is similar with big citrus, some apricot, and lemon. Medium in body and delicious overall.

Pours hazy grapefruit into a snifter. White head with excellent retention recedes to skim surface. Mango, passionfruit and citrus aromas. Soft with bitter sourdough and yeast upfront turning to dry tropical fruit before the lasting pith finish.

Bottled July 2015, drunk early August 15 and again mid-January 16.Great appearance, with a moderate haze to the lime-tinted bronze body. Large white head shows strong retention.It was interesting to try the beer under a month old and then six months old. It may seem ridiculous to even bother noting its character at six months of age, but Id actually say that with the massive, massive amount of hops, acid/bitterness and yeast character in this thing, it didnt hurt to keep it (very cold fridged) for a while. Young the stuff is just a plethora of every possible hop characteristics; pineapple, wintergreen, dank marajuana, earthiness, pine, citrus. There is some definite yeast stink to it but the alcohol is fairly well-concealed (though a touch of heat, for sure). In the flavor, its quite bitter, though perhaps not anything absurd for a DIPA. Lots of grapefruit, some grassiness, pineapple and tangerine. The carapils and C40 do add some toasted character, but its not too much of an interference. Texture shows soft, well-attenuated maltiness and tight carbonation.In the end, Id opine its probably a bit better to give this thing a month or so to have the yeastiness and strong bitterness some time to fade. Certainly a well-made beer, though aggressive, as MBC hoppy beers are.

Thank you Mathieu87 & PriorL! 500 ml. bottle sampled @ Mathieus house cooling party. Bottled on 24.10.2015. Very hazy orange peach, little bubbles. Nose is very yeasty, big yeast & murky peach, apricot hop soup with doughy & dash sugary sweetness. Taste is sweetish dough, sugar, sweetish passion fruit sorbet, yeast & hop soup, sugar, herbs, quite yeasty. Sweetish yeasty & dough body. Comparable to the work of Trillium & Tree House, this is how the newest & hippest USA breweries make IPAs these days. People adore it but I dont entirely get these hop & yeast soup concoctions yet. This is one is not bad but too sweetish & yeasty for me.

First let me say this is a beer Ive been trying to get for a while and so I am biased. Pretty good birthday beer. Pours hazy golden orange, like the inside of nectarine. Big gorgeous fluffy white head, lacing clings to the glass. Aroma is dank hops, orange, pineapple, mango, very minimal pepper note, peach,  but lots of dankness and tropical fruit. Flavor is hop-forward, wow. Big hop bite, tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, pine. Light/medium effervescence, slightly oily. Gorgeous. Nice resiny bitter hop finish. This beer is exceptional.

Knowing this was in fridge I couldnt resist cracking right away. Yellownorange fine two finger head. Beautiful nose tropical fruits and a bit doughy. Tastes of melon, mango, pineapple, resin, dough, grassy and light hop bitterness. Creamy carbonation and lingering finish of bitter hops and fruit. Huge thanks to my cousin Jeff for bringing back from the homeland for me.
Pours a pale golden orange with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus, grass and resin. Somewhat juicy with a moderately butter flavor.
Grapefruit, aroma, blast of explosion of pure beautiful beer craftsmanship. Seriously delivers the hype happy new year.
Bottle. Pours hazy bright orange with some white head. Nose is pineapple, orange, pine, tangerine. Taste is just as rich with some nice bitterness and malt sweetness. Great aftertaste. Great beer!

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Smells like a tropical fruit smoothie and pours a perfectly clear golden-orange. Taste is dry, balanced, very hoppy. Lots and lots of strong fruit taste, but in a complex way, and it finishes surprisingly clean and neat. A near-perfect beer, and quite possibly the best thing Ive ever had.

Bottle. Pours murky yellow with a thin white head that lingers. Smells exactly like grapefruit. Mild carbonation. Complex hop flavors superior to most. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of light honey, tropical, very light peppery. Taste is tropical and tangerine, citrus, floral, light spicy, oranges. Dry and bitter finish, well balanced.

Bottle @ Rekvium, Orla and Dolles dødsyge søndagssmagning, 2015. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose is sweet and dusty I almost said with notes of DMS. Flavor is juicy, dry, sharp and really tasty. Well balanced, tasty, although quite malty!

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, light dust, light skunk, kinda weird nose. Taste is a hop explosion, alot of grape, pineapple, light thislte, very clean taste. Finish is light sweet, bitter. Nice.
Bottle: Poured an orange with white head. Complex very hops and fruit. Nice huge hops forward with fruitiness.

Bottle shared by jared. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, light grassy, and some dough. Taste is good fruity hops with mild sweetness but a little flabby and lacks punch. Overall still a great beer but taste doesnt live upto nice aroms.

Bottle from trade. Lives up to the hype. Pours a cloudy glowing golden yellow with a full white head. Aromas of peach and melon and white wine. Light pineapple and Passionfruit. Tangerine. Taste is barely bitter. Slightly sweet but finishes so clean. Can totally crush this. Soft and juicy.
Poured an orange color with a white head. Aroma was of apricots, peaches, light resnous, orange rind. Flavor was super clean, juicy, dry ipa. These guys amaze me sometimes.
Bottle shared thanks to Art. Poured hazy orange with white head. Aroma balanced pine and grapefruit. Light carb med bod. Taste quite high octane, dry peach skin.

500ml bottle thanks to dmac! Its his dream to take me on a date. This is the closest hell get to "buying me dinner." Sorry Dave Im married...and I like girls. Poured a cloudy straw color with a small foamy white head. Aroma is super juicy! Tangerine, orange, melon, grapefruit, and lots of pine sap. Taste of tangerine, pine sap, grapefruit pulp and skins, bread, citrus zest, and some grass.

Thanks to Kenny for the hookup. Review from notes.

Two bottles, approximately a week apart. The first bottle was 6 days old at time of consumption. The first bottle was close to perfect, while the second was merely outstanding. 

Yellow body, mild haze, thick white cap. Looks like my kind of IPA. Glorious aroma. Fruity, hoppy, citrusy, dank, loveliness. Hop forward with minimal malt character. A bouquet of flowery hops and tangy, juicy citrus. Medium bodied with just the slightest hint of alcohol warmth in the finish. Outstanding.

Bottle shared. Pours very hazy golden orange with a medium white head. Aroma of massive citrus from several feet away, with grapefruit, pine, juicy tropical fruit, orange peel and caramel malt hidden behind the onslaught of hops. Flavour is light moderate sweet and light heavy bitter. Medium bodied with a juicy resinous hop coating mouthfeel and light carbonation. Lovely!

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis, bottled 24/10/15
Thin creamy white head. Hoppy aroma (even I can smell it :-). Cloudy golden pour. Lovely bitterness. An excellent IPA.

Bottle. Finally landed this whale. Poured a cloudy yellow with a bubbly white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, tropical, and a dankness. Flavor had grapefruit, orange, lemon, pineapple, pine, dank, and nicely bitter. Medium to full body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish. Very well done.

102415 bottle thanks to ineedbeer. The beer is a medium-wish yellow. Nice and pale. The liquid is fairly cloudy - you can see through it but just barely. The head is big and white. Big chunks of bubbles sticking to the walls of the glass. Good retention. The aroma is bright and juicy, Lots of excellent hop flavor. Huge pineapple, tangerine, papaya, a mild lime edge, mango, mild pine underneath. Candied lemon and orange peel. Malt is quite mild. Just some simple sweetness, barely there really. The taste has a bit more of that pine resin flavor. Gets just a tiny bit bland with bitterness, but its excellent, and I like that they didnt shy away from some bitterness. The beer is fairly dry with moderate astringency. I actually expected drier from MBC. Lots of that tropical citrus hoppiness. Mouthfeel is soft and light with a touch of hop oiliness. Little booziness to it.  Drinks smoothly and easily for the abv.  Very good. Overall, this is an excellent DIPA. Im not sure why but this batch seems much improved over the other batch that I tried.

Bottle via trade from BA. Poured a medium viscosity of deep gold with a bubbly white head. Aroma is like s Christmas tree, pine sap, some citrus rind.Flavor is similar, dry citrus, pine needles, light earth, dirty arm pit. Good body, palate is medium with average carbonation. Solid

Week old bottle from the latest release. Dinner has a really nice aroma, grassy, floral, hoppy, a bit of onion, really nice and balanced. The taste is pretty good but its a little too light for me. This essentially tastes like a bigger Lunch, in the vein that most Maine beers pretty must taste the same, maybe its the yeast. I was hoping for a bigger punch of hops in my face. This would have been great 5 years ago. Todays its just a decent way over hyped dipa.

Shared bottle at Craft Ale House. Turbid golden pour with well-laced white head. Nose was juicy and dripping with aroma; hops, tangerine, pineapple, honeydew, white pepper, mild funk. Tasted incredible, with juicy hops, citrus, grapefruit, melon, tangerine, pineapple, and a super smooth and hefty mouthfeel that just makes you want to shove a gallon down your eager throat and drink until you needed to get your stomach pumped. Hell yeah!

Bottle thanks to red beard. 1 week old pours out a cloudy straw topped with a white head. Nose is great fresh hops nice combo and a little malty sweetness. Taste is great nice fresh hops floral citrus and a nice balance end.

Bottle from a trade. Snifter at home. (kinda old...my fault.) Poured a muddy orange-tan and some head with lace. The aroma is floral hops, rather delicate, slight danbkness, lemon, orange, and grass. The taste was rather mild for a DIPA with lots of citrus and floral hops, a mild malt backbone, and a dry papery finish. (Probably because it was old.) Great flavor and aroma in this one. Medium body, light carb. Great beer.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Thanks to Paul. Hazy yellow - orange beer, small cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry. Mild fine carbonation. Light pale malts. Dry floralness. Good hop spice. Mild skunk. Tropical fruits. Light semi dry finish. Hop spice lingers on. Nice balance of flavours here, but not a shouty DIPA.

Poured from a 6 day old bottle courtesy of toxiclogic. 
Aroma is very hoppy with a lot of nice tropical fruit and citrus along with a lighter dank, resinous note in the background. Some light cracker malt notes with a touch of caramel. Some light pineapple and moderate mango with a medium light melon note. Nice orange and tangerine character. Really nice fruitiness with a well balanced resin character.
Pours a slightly hazy, bright yellow-gold with a large, thick, frothy, white head that exhibits really nice retention as it slowly recedes. Medium high lacing and medium small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with nice cracker notes and a touch of a light caramel character. Some light graininess too. Medium high bitterness with a light alcohol spice. Moderately strong hop flavors with mango and citrus being most prevalent. Nice medium light resin notes with some lighter stone fruit, pineapple and melon. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low, but present alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this is a damn tasty beer with an even better aroma. Nice hop profile in aroma and flavor, good malt notes, just a touch of alcohol to remind you its a beer.

Draft at the brewery. Couldnt resist stopping through here, and glad I did! Pours a hazy golden peach color with an off white head. Aroma is massively juicy, fleshy fruits, oily. Flavor has a big fleshy tropical fruit hop presence without any bitterness. Thick flavorful mouthfeel with a lingering tropical hops. Absolutely wonderful!

Bottle share at the 42nd floor tasting, many thanks to Paul! 8.2%. Hazy orange, still, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is candied lemon, jelly lemon slices, rubbery, a little dank onion, perfume. Body is medium, soft carbonation, smooth. Taste is passionfruit, flowery hops, citrus, grassy finish with a touch of booze. Great stuff.

Bottle split at the 42nd floor Tasting, massive thanks to Paul, 08/10/15.
Hazed orange golden topped with a solid egg shell white covering. 
Nose is sprucey forest, pine, orange pith, grapefruit shreds, light herbal notes. 
Taste comprises grapefruit, dank hop strokes, straw, tangerine, vanilla, caramel, orange pith. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with juicy hop bitterness. 
Solid DIPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle via trade, consumed at the 42nd floor tasting. It pours lightly hazy gold with medium white head. The nose is so very soft, juicy apricot, peach, papaya, nectarine, sweaty action and passion fruit. The taste is crisp, clean, bitter, rather soft, orange peel, passion fruit, mango, limited alcohol heat, grapefruit, light grass and straw with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate. Impressive juicy how delicate and soft this is. Very drinkable. Excellent stuff.

Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Thanks to Paul this one. Translucent bright yellow / straw coloured pour with a lasting loose white head. Aroma is lovely dank citrus fruits, mango, pithy citrus. Layered hop character on the nose. Flavour is composed of decent Base grains, straw, tropical tropical, mango flesh, pithy citrus, Super happy. Palate is airy carbonation, soft on the tongue, some sticky hop resin. Assertive smooth hop bitterness. Really clean for the abv

Where: A gift enjoyed at a tasting event, thanks Maxbier and dlovell2. Appearance: Pours an orange/golden color with a light fluffy head. Aroma: Citrus hops, tropical and mango. Taste: Much like the aroma, it was extremely citrus-y and fruity, and not overly bitter. Palate: Smooth and good carbonation. Overall: Easily one of the best IIPAs you could ever have.

50cl bottle at the 42nd level tasting, London. Thanks to Scopey for this one. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is rich with citrus, grapefruit, apricot, skunk, peach, caramel. Taste is light booze and medium sweet, with notes of citrus, apricot and skunk. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, excellent

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours unclear gold with a frothy white head. Great aroma, lots of peach and tangerine, slight pine, pale bread. Medium sweet flavor with rich citrusy fruits, papaya, melon, mango, light alcohol boost, light bitter grass, soft pale malts. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Resinous finish, lightly warming, with rich hop character, pale bread, buckets of citrus, more papaya and mango. Extremely soft and drinkable. Tremendous.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Pours hazy bright orange with a small white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: tangerines, pineapple, orange, mango, herbal/floral hops, spice, pine bitterness, peppercorn, lightly malty, tropical fruits, herbs, leaves and lemon zest. TASTE: hop oil spice, pineapple, tangerines, orange, malty, spruce bitterness, citrus, peppercorn, tropical fruits, leaves, herbs, slight grass bitterness, alcohol and light belgian yeast esters. AFTER TASTE: pine bitterness, hop spice, tangerines and peppercorn with an oily medium body finish and a boozy warmth in the chest.

16.9 oz bottle. Hazy golden orange with a splat and some edging. Nose is melon, musk, toffee, grass and pink grapefruit. Medium body with a soft sparkle. Taste is bitter orange, peach, pine, guava and honey. Lingering citrus peel. Great stuff. Like a bite of fresh fruit with a kick.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized to large, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (grain), lightly hoppy (melon), with notes of onion/garlic/asafetida, alcohol.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

Not enjoyable...big time oniony nose, probably caused by shitty ol Simcoe (Mosaic can smell like that sometimes too, though, but thats probably whats yielding the melon note). A drain pour but I still love my Clarky Bear!

Bottle. Lightly hazed gold with a lasting white head. Hoppy aroma is pine resin, tropical fruit, stinky cheese, onion, shallot, doughy yeast. Medium bodied, moderately sweet, juicy, fruity, soft, velvety in the mouth. Nicely malty and rich in the mouth, not overly bitter, but muddled by yeast to make it duller than it should be. Nothing out of sorts here but its not very intriguing.

Thanks Matt, good with Roberto's lasagna.. Hazy gold .. Great foam .. Fresh, clean, and sappy .. A winner 


.. . . Jesus wants you to have some Popsicles 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1300th rating!!!!. Pours medium orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus peels, pine resin, juicy tropical fruits, some dank hops, herbal notes, and grassy hops. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long lingering finish. Overall, a excellent, world class DIPA from a brewer that continues to impress me.
500ml bottle pours a hazy yellow with a white head. very hoppy, grapefruit pine taste

Thanks Patrick! A surprise gift in a surprise box of treats. Incredible resiny nose. Maltiness subtly sits behind a cascade of hoppy bliss. The flavor matches the aroma. Incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from thepatrickman-thanks for this long time want! Bottled 6/20/15 enjoyed 7/18/15 before Wilco show at Red Rocks. Deep orange yellow with thick slow fading head. Heavily perfumed floral nose with some resinous and light citrus elements. Dry and bitter, but balanced with piney, floral, and orange hops. Great balance, smooth, and alcohol well hidden but packing a punch.

Pours a clear golden with a thick white head...nice retention and lacing. Aroma has spicy/grassy notes, pine and grapefruit. Flavor has fresh pine...resinous...grapefruity and rindy. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry piney/resinous/rindy finish that warms a bit. Great floral and resinous hop notes...delicious.
500ml bottle from trade. Hazy golden pour with minimal head. Fresh grassy hops aroma. Taste is so fresh, bottled 7 days ago. So tasty...really glad I tried it!
Bottle shared by Tom - thanks! Super fresh, bottles 7 days ago. Hazy yellow pour with a smaller white head. Mosaic explodes on aroma. Smooth slightly sweet taste. No hint of booze. Killer.

I know its a matter of taste, but this is quite simply the best Imperial IPA I have ever drank. Poured from a bottle on the same day it was bottled, into a tulip. Beautiful light orange color and a light frothy head that stays around a while. Floral and citrus nose, with a taste to match that is smooth in the mouth and grapefru

Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white foamy head that stays long. Copious lacing. Nose is pure hop blast - floral, piney bouquet. Taste is beautifully balanced: huge malty sweetness up front with a fade to grapefruit pith. Stellar brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

dense light yellowish head leaves structured lacing. orangeblonde colour. aroma is hops, grapefruit, passionfruit, bit sweet, hint of sulphur. taste is caramel, dextrins, sweet, balanced by a fruity hoppiness of grapefruit, resinous. quite dense body, medium carbonation. good, but a bit too sweet. for my likingbottle 50cl / bd apr-2015

Poured from 16oz bottle at home. Obtained via a (steep!) trade. Pours clear bright orange with white fluffy head. Aroma is tropical, citrus, orange, and grapefruit. Taste is basically the same, an absolute perfect IIPA. Vanilla, pine, and just super fruity. No bite or bitterness at all. It lives up to the hype.

this is near a perfect beer as they can come. strong aroma of mango and bubblegum. strong mango citrus flavor with little bitterness. nice hoppy backbone balances this beer out perfectly. had a bomber share with kaser. beer porn. pours cloudy tellow with a thin white head

Cloudy golden pour from the bottle, thin off-white head. Huge grapefruit and tropical mango aroma (fills the surrounding area). Lemon bitter, grapefruit, mango, pineapple, some malt sweetness but not sugary. Finish is a hint grassy but predominantly grapefruit and mango. Lives up to the hype. Owe a million thank yous to Steven W!! Thanks for sharing your Dinner at lunch!

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Armin. Thanks man! Pour is hazy golden with a big white head and sticky lacing. Orange peel, pineapple, mango, papaya, lemon peel,.grapefruit, biscuit, and straw in the aroma. Taste is big grapefruit peel, oranges, pineapple, biscuit, mango,some dough, grass, and pine with a big bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Really tasty and fruit forward IPA.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice tropical fruit, orange, hints of grass, pine, nice earth, slight grain. Taste was a mix of tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, nice bread, biscuit, hints of yeast into a bit of grain, slight grain, finishing slightly bitter,slightly sweet.

Bottle, a couple of weeks old. Slightly hazy but bright gold pour, big lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is incredible: huge tangerine, bright apricot, candied pineapple, danker tropical fruit (mango), some sweeter piney sappinness. Taste gives big mango upfront, juicy and dank, some brighter tangerine, light canteloupe in there, some sappy pine, light weedy note; framed by light biscuit/shortcake malt. Mango and a zestier citrus note add to a mid-dry finish, with mid bitterness factor. Lingering tropical dankness and lightly mouth-coating pine. Good Lord. This is the best DIPA Ive ever had, and Ive had a good few of them. Eternal thanks to thepatrickman for getting this to me!

Aroma: Citrus, Rind, Mildly Piney

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

Taste: Citrus, Rind, Mildly Piney

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2015 re-rate after new tasting, bottle in trade. Pour is still golden with white head. Aroma is super dank. taste is dank-tastic, with some cat pissy character. It lingers a long as time too. Better than my original 4 rating.

Bottle share thanks to homer. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is mix of dank and citrus. Light mouthfeel danky hops. Really nice DIPA.

Holy fuck!!! So balanced! Best IPA I've ever had. Maybe best beer ever 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly hazy pale yellow pour. Slight white head. Nice hoppy nose. Really nice citrus, dank hoppy goodness. Dry finish with a nice bitterness.

Bottle (500 ml). Bottle on April 11th 2015, so 2 weeks old. Shared by cparles, thanks! Split 4-ways.

Appearance: Hazy glowing golden-orange with a small white head and heavy lacing. 

Aroma: Intensely hoppy, dank and juicy with onions, grapefruits, oranges and a touch of alcohol. 

Taste: Slightly sweet and quite juicy with dank hops, grapefruits, onions, oranges, a good malt backbone, light spiciness and light to moderate bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Dry finish. Onions and grapefruits aftertaste. 

Overall: This is a great DIPA. Super juicy hops and nice dank presence. The malt backbone is strong enough to support the insane amount of hops, but never hinder drinkability. Really tasty. Loved it.

Bottle, beautiful glowing pale gold pour with white head. Aroma is really great, super pungent and juicy hop, very light onion, dank hoppiness, passion fruit, grapefruit. Taste is bitter, great juicy fruit punch flavor, light bitterness, very fun. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation, dry. Very, very good.

Loved everything about this beer. Wanted to not believe it was worth the hype, but between the amazingly fresh scents and complex flavor I was convinced. More refined than Lunch, the fruity scent is great and the finish has zero bitterness or bad aftertaste. Can't wait to get bottled versions of it.
Bottle. Hazy orange with a little white head. Delicious citrus carries the day giving an almost mimosa like quality. Booze is not super hidden but also not overwhelming. Rich mouthfeel. Excellent.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and floral. Taste is grapefruit, lemon, orange, tropical, floral, malt, and some pine. Lives up to its billing.

500ml bottle, pours a bright orange, a chill haze, nice 2 finger white head. Good retention, nice lacing. Aromas are very nice tropical fruits, hints of zest, earth and flowers. Taste is sharp upfront with an initial bite that calms into mellow sweetness and then to dankness. Grapefruit, lemon and spruce melt into mango, peach and earth. Nice yeast interplay, pretty soft mouth-feel too. Finishes with some light alcohol notes covered by a moderate to heavy hop bitterness. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 Bottle from 4/11/15 9 days old. Cloudy bright yellow, big lacing, soapy head. Aroma is incredible-- grapefruit, mango, peach, and apricot. The taste adds delicate malt, light grass, orange, pineapple, honey, and more. Completely balanced flavors with a resinous feel and lingering bitterness. Absolutely amazing. MBC does it again. --- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle shared by urbancaver- thanks again, Cam! Pours a cloudy gold with an uneven white head that has big bubbles on one side. Plenty of individual spots of lace in the glass. Notes of florals, orange peel, ruby red grapefruit, sweet and caramel malts, pine resin, honey, green tea, and some light grass and herbs. Medium-full bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, resinous, bitter mouthfeel. So well balanced and satisfying on the palate. Great DIPA.

Nose is super dank. Straight grass, weed, herb, citrus, fruit, tropical yum. Hazy orange. Medium sized white head. Taste is all hop water with a light green tea bitterness. No malt at all. Actually to the point of being too malty low. Hops are well done though.
500ml bottle pours a yellow amber color without much head. Bottled 12/6/14. Mellow hop profile. A little noticeable alcohol harshness.

Many thanks to Steve for providing the bottle!

Has a glowing orange color, with a soon collapsing, bubbly head.

Got an intense, fruity nose, with lots of juicy oranges, among herbs and glazed malts. The orange yields a glue like aspect, as well as prickly kiwi notes, with a resinous impact, blending well into the sweeter smells.

Taste is more herbaceous than the nose revealed, with a gentle influence of fresh cut grass, balanced by pine and wooden, slightly biscuity malts. On top of that settles the orange fruitiness, with lots of white peel being noteable, while an enjoyable hop bitterness becomes visible, getting easily balanced by the earthy malts and a lower, well fitting carbonation, which provides a very smooth mouthfeel. The present malt backbone gets joined by a slick, semi dry kiwi punch, among chunks of grapefruit during the finish, pulling the beer into a hoppier direction. Amazingly balanced, easy drinkable double IPA, with an ever evolving, gentle hop character.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Re-rate 6/16: Bottle sample at a tasting at Bens place. Thanks Ariel. 5 days old bottle. Hazy yellow with a white head. Great hoppy aroma, with lots of citrus, tropical fruits, onion. Rather dry flavor with a sweetish hint, with fruity and oniony hops. Medium-bodied. Very nice. Score is updated. 8/4/7/3/14=3.6

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Amit. Cloudy yellow-orange with a white head. Rather stale fruity hops aroma - still quite pleasant though. Flavor has some sweetish malt, stale hops and pretty strong and slightly harsh bitterness. Medium-bodied. Hope Ill get to try it fresher someday. 7/3/6/3/13=3.2

Bottle dated 7/31. Pours a slightly brownish amber with one finger of white head. Aroma is very nice considering the age of the bottle: mango, grapefruit, light scallions, weed, orange peel, honey. Taste is crisp orange and honey with some sweet malts and mango. Lightly boozy finish. Low bitterness, low carbonation. Very full and silky in the mouth. Excellent.

50cl, at 8.2%Vol, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Wouter for bringing this over!, very complex bitter brew, fruity/floral/bitter and slightly malty/sweet, yet not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Bottle - Pours a light golden yellow w/ white head. Smells of oranges, tangerines, and grapefruits. A slight maltiness and lots of citrus flavors with a dry bitter end. This beer is damn good!!!

Lightly hazed orange pour with creamy white head. Aroma is sweet malt, abv, and citrus. Sweet caramel malt, abv, along with a dry finish on the flavor. A very nice warmth on this beer. Medium body with good carbonation. Very nice

Bottle - Cloudy golden pour with a huge foamy white head. Nose is honey, melon, dank onion and garlic, and tropical fruit. Sweet, sticky malt in the taste, with huge stinky dank hops and a bready backbone that comes through on the finish. Long hoppy finish with ample sweetness. Some boozy warmth peeks through, but its not overbearing. Thick and oily, with mild carbonation. A little much for my tastes, but pretty good for the style.
Absolutely awesome beer, reminds me of Another One flavor wise, but much more dank with hops. I have nothing bad to say about this beer, if you can find it, it is a must try.

(500ml bottle) clear gold, soapy white bubbles. Nose is dank, citrus rind, candied hops, lemon. Taste is awesome, candied citrus, super well balanced, orange, lemon, medium body, slick oily body. Amazing dipa.

Pours a lightly hazed peach orange with a small white head. Nose is on a really pleasant herbal hop which has a definite funky note, described by a friend as being more Nelson-esque than Citra in that sense. Stone fruits and a touch "meaty" in the funkiness of the hops. Mouth is pretty soft, still quite pungent, evolving. Herbal, something I would call "rancio" on the finish which is actually quite nice. A bit heavy abv might bring this down just a touch.  Still, really good.

This was nearly a perfect IIPA. Huge hop aroma with citrus and apricot. Taste is full, bitter, and with hints of pleasant sweetness. This is yet another example of how the East Coast (in the north at least...) might be outdoing the other side in terms of IIPA.

The beer pours a gorgeous, golden, orange, settling into the glass with a creamy, off-white head of minuscule bubbles that lasts at a fingers width above the beer. The head leaves sticky fat fluff of lacing when it rescinds. In body, the beer is a nearly opaque murk of tiny particulates and haze. On the nose is where this beer is king. From the moment you pop the bottle you know you are in for a tropical fruit bomb. Even from a foot away, my glass is oozing fruit salad scent across the nose, but when I get my nostrils nicely in the glasss bulb, Im met with decadent and complex hop aromas. Pine resin blends with pineapple, mango, soft melon, and fruity caramel. Alcohol does prickle at the edges of the nose, but only if you search for it, and as a whole the nose just comes off smelling like a hugely aromatic fruit salad with accents of pine. This has got one damn fine nose. On the tongue, the beer tastes sweet up front, but with definite bitter balance that builds into the middle and finish of the beer wonderfully. Booze makes its presence known towards the finish of the sip, punching through some of the decadent hop notes while acidity is faintly present on the fringes of the tongue. In flavor the beer begins as pineapple juice, moving more towards pine with flashes of medicinal hops, bright grass, lemon citrus, and grapefruit juice. Slight alcohol and caramel hops enter in the middle of the sip, but the finish of the beer is straight ruby red grapefruit juice with just a hint of booze. The aftertaste is of piney/grapefruity hops. In the mouth, the beer feels medium to full bodied, with a middling carb that provides a healthy scrub to the tongue. Mouthfeel is crisp and effervescent, if a touch heavy towards the finish of the sip. Overall, this is a hell of a Double IPA. Ive already heard it compared to the Headys and Plinys of the world (gasp) but I think that was a forgone conclusion. MBC makes some damn fine hoppy beer and this is no exception. This beer strikes towards the top of the DIPA list for sure, and is a true work of art in terms of juicy, tropical fruit hops. I do have some quibbles with it, however, as I do with any beers. For starters, I think the booze could be a little better integrated, as it does add a bit too much heat towards the back of the sip. I also feel that the nose far outweighs the taste in terms of overall decadence and hop character, which can be argued as an attribute of DIPAs, but since we are talking God-Tier DIPAs I must say that others of this plateau have met that balance more so than Dinner. The nose is where Dinner is a winner, for sure, and she is a damn fine winner. Drink the beer fresh. Enjoy it. Wait in line for three hours if you want to. Its a nice beer.
Bottle shared by Jake at weekly tasting. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of grapefruit, tropical fruit, grass, lemon and light malt. Very flavorful. Medium-full bodied.
Bottle. Hazy orange pour with white head. Well first time in awhile Im impressed by an ipa. Very fresh citrus, grassy and herbal hop tones.

Pours bright hazy golden orange with think sticky head. Smell is heavy pine, resin, citrus, and dank hops. Taste is pine, citrus, dank floral hops, grapefruit, mango and resin. Super complex and amazing mouth feel. Medium body, medium carbonation.

Hazy yellow. White head. Fruity nose. More rye and spelt grain. Great mouthfeel. Really amazing mouthfeel. Loads of simcoe and citra and maybe some centennial. Nice body and clove and peppermint. A lot going on here and really delicious

Bottle, dated 073114. 4 days old. Huge thanks to Matt. It smells like hops and tastes like hops. Fresh hops. Eating them off the vine fresh. Bitter with a cannon to the face explosion of citrus fruit. Grapefruit and mango and pineapple. Amazing stuff. Might be the best IPA Ive ever had. Opened a fresh can of heady right after and my taste buds couldnt detect it.

Bottle, thanks to a hugely generous patron at ChurchKey. Pours a slightly hazy peach color with decent white frothy head. Nose and flavor are completely terrific, with dank wet grass, spruce and pine, candied orange, kumquat, apricot, loam, and earth all over the place. Hints of sticky sweetness that allude to the ABV, but gorgeously and frighteningly drinkable. As expected, a complete masterpiece. Reminiscent of Abner, certainly in overall quality and in many traits as well. World class.

Trade with Willrunforbeer - thanks!Orange, with a ring of foam. Smells grassy, stoney, with a touch of caramel Taste is citrusy, with lots of fresh hop "pop". Plenty of fresh baked bread maltiness, as well. Another solid offering from Maine Beer Company...

A great thanks to tectactoe. It pours a vibrant sunny orange color with a thick lasting head. A very distinct aroma comes off this. A big hop presence along with a fruity pine scent. Very unique. The taste is very similar to the smell somehow. It is extremely unique. You could pick this beer out of a crowd of IPAs. Very drinkable. Honestly I want to drink it all day. The taste is just so fresh and clean. Very good and one of the better IPAs Ive had in a long time.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate citrus, tropical fruits, light dank notes, and grapefruit. It pours a hazy golden-orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a soapy ring. The flavor starts with citrus, tropical fruits, and mango. The finish has moderate grapefruit, light dank notes, and faint florals. Its light bodied with light-moderate and a soft mouthfeel.
bottle, thanks to Kristen & Pat, slightly hazed blonde orange, lots of citrus peel & pith, slight herbal notes. extremely smooth drinking, great mouthfeel. great IIPA

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Bottle from trade with WillRunForBeer. Huge thanks. About 1 month from bottling. Pours a very dense and cloudy golden amber color with a nice frothy head never completely fades. Awesome dank aroma. Grapefruit, tropical fruit, pine, peaches, fruit cocktail juice, and blood oranges. Taste super juicy and dank. Blood oranges, tropical fruit, and pine come through the most. Super smooth oily mouthfeel. Light bitterness. This is up there with some of my favorite DIPAs. Re-rate 6/29/15. Bottle thanks to thepatrickman. 2 weeks old. Still an amazing aroma but theres something about the huge soft carbonation that distracts a little. Makes it harder to drink than it should be. Still love it but no longer a top DIPA for me.

On tap at the brewery. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of tropical fruity and citrusy and resinous hops, a nice pale maltiness to balance it out, and some light dough. Flavor the same with an incredible hoppiness. Average texture. I knew itd be good based on Lunch, but it exceeded expectations.

Bottle from the main man Lukaduke! Just about 3 weeks old and 3000+ miles from the source and its still kickin. Mosaic / Simcoe / Citra doing their thang. Pours a light, slightly hazy orange with a nice white head. Tropical hops punch through but everything is in balance. Dangerously drinkable at 8.2% and probably a good thing I only have one of these around. Wait, not at all!

Thanks to Ryan for sharing this. Pours hazy gold. Citrus, pine, herbal/mint, alcohol. Dry, something almost smoky for a flash, bitter finish, orange peel. Night, bright, citrus-a-licious. Medium body, avg carb. Great!

Bottle: Huge thanks to NHhomebrewguy. Completely opaque, somehow even more dense, radiant, & beaming than Lunch with a light-ecru cap made of dense foam that lasts well into the beer. Pungent hop oils, moderate dankness, juicy tangerine flesh with underpinning tropical fruits - mango, guava, mild passion fruit - going to town on your nostrils. Back-end has a light hint of floralness to it with just a light kiss of herbal perfume. Taste is off the charts oily hops & a mess of fruit rinds; mild hemp oil dank notes with wave after wave of pungent mango juice, guava, grapefruit, tangerine... The tropical assault continues relentlessly. Hidden green onion freshness with the finish more focused on zesty, floral hops, tangerine peel, & hop oils. You almost dont notice due to the juiciness of the brew, but the aftertaste leaves a pleasantly strong bitterness on the palate. Finishes quite dry, as do most of MBCs hoppy brews, leaving a mild resinous feeling behind. Maine has already impressed me previously; Dinner is incredible. They NEED to produce this beer more often & in larger quantity.

Large, dense, off white head with excellent retention and nice lacing. Murky, gold colored body. Bold nose of grapefruit and lesser pine, somewhat dank and grassy with a hint of scallions and juicy tropical notes. Body is fully medium with a soft carbonation, little acidic but juicy, lightly chewy. Danky hop flavors along with plenty of citrus notes, grapefruit, mild pine, leafy and melony Slightly sweet pale malts, some dough. Juicy hop bomb, nicely resiny and chewy, Finishes dry and bitterness is solid. NICE stuff! Props to WillRunForBeer for bonusing me this bottle. Thanks Brian! Bottle dated 5.21.14 Awesome!

Pours golden orange with medium white head and some lacing. Aroma: tropical fruits all around (mangos, peaches, grapefruits, lemon), flowers, and hops. Fruity bitterness. Alcohol is well hidden, a very nice DIPA

500 mL bottle supplied by WillRunForBeer. Many thanks! To long-stemmed tulip, it pours a hazy bright orange with which a whitish-ringed head 1 finger in length stood. Aromas of lemon peels, Oude Bruin dregs, marsh rosemary, California fresh white sage, lavender, sweet basil, West coast hops, green hay, and corn. Tastes the same with the addition of blueberry leaves, sweat, leeks, and bay leaves. Smells paints a picture that was going to be a masterpiece, but the flavors didnt meld fully together. Still a wonderful, juicy DIPA, but just not in the whale-level of awesomeness I was expecting.

Bottle @ Gregs dump. Pours a murky yellow orange appearance with a nice off white head. Some yeast, bright citrus fruity, grapefruity, dank aroma. Quite spicy, big juicy, tangerine, pineapple flavor. Full body. Awesome.
Bloody hell. Drink this fresh. Amazing beer. Just drink this fresh. Amazing DIPA.
Bottle. Clear amber in color with a thin white head. Aroma of resin, malt citrus and pine. Malty flavor with big oniony hops through to the finish.

Slightly hazy orangish-gold color; dense, frothy white head. Orange, grapefruit, mango, and floral notes. The sliver of initial sweetness quickly becomes dried citrus peel bitter. Lively, not quite medium bodied, with a very long resin finish.

Bottle from trade, thanks Nick! Pours pale yellow gold with a big white head that clings. Aroma of tropical fruit fills the room when this is poured - mango, tangerine, some pine as well. Soft mouthfeel, just a touch of caramel in a pale malt backbone that supports waves of juicy hop. Flavors are again tropical, mango, tangerine. Pine resin bitterness in the finish.

Bottle shared by MrBarleywine, huge thanks Mike!
Pours a lightly hazy light golden color with a decent sized long lasting frothy white head. Huge tangerine, melon, and resinous citrus aromas. Damn that is frikin divine. The flavor is firm tropical fruit pine and citrus hop flavors with just a hint of sweet bread deep underneath. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation. Good lord that is a damn fine IPA right there. Huge juicy fruity hop aroma and flavor. I wish I had more.

This beer is like mo, lunch and another one all mixed together. Super sharp hop flavor of citrus rind with the super smoothness of malt that mbc is so good at. Beer is dated 5 21.14, yeah thats today. Had it on draft and from bottle. Its impressive at all temperatures as well. This is hop nirvana.

On tap at Blind Tiger. This keg kicked in 25 mins and with good reason. Special beer with great hop complexity and beautiful grassy aroma. Been waiting for Maine to do a dIPA and this one certainly didnt disappoint. Now if we could only get some more production/availability.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured hazy yellow amber color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with very good lacing. Medium to heavy earthy citrus hop and resin aroma. Medium to full body with slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy smooth bittersweet citrus flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of average to long duration.This is a standout beer.

500ml bottle, thanks to alexsdad06 for sharing. Bottled 3/11/14, enjoyed 4/2/14. Totally hazy yellow orange color. Thin off-white head. Fine dots of lace. Awesome big hop aroma... Grass, citrus, apricot. Nice big zesty sweet taste, lightly tangy, moderate to bigger bitter. Finishes very dry, medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of creamy lighter carbonation. Fantastic stuff. Super nice. Long, hoppy, but balanced aftertaste.

500 ml bottle shared with the group. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have dank, citrus, herbal and some catty hops. Enough bready and light caramel malts to add balance. Great, fresh double ipa sent by Lukaduke.

16.9 oz bottle to snifter (shared by alexsdad06). Looks good; a hazy golden orange with off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good; juicy hops with a bit of bitterness and a mild pale malt backbone. Tastes like it. Smells with. Some green onion as well. Nice on the palate; nice and dry. I like this one; the hops do the work.

Pours a ripe golden color with a sticky two fingers of eggshell foam. Lots of citrus, tangerine and traces of tropical fruit on the nose. Palate follows... big juicy front end gets a bit earthy and bitter in the middle and lingers with a long bitter finish. Tasty.

Bottle sent hella fresh thanks to JBPortland. Bottling date 03/11. Pours very cloudy, golden amber with a medium off-white head that dissipates slowly and laces well. Aroma is nice and dank tropical, passionfruit, mango, guava. Flavor is super juicy, light sweet and light bitter, resinous and rich, tropical and dank, no harshness at all. Full body, oily mouthfeel. This is one of the best I have tried. MOAR....

Bottle with a date of 3-11-14. Aroma is citrus hops "Gone Wild" grapefruit, pineapple, mango and hint of grass. Bouquet of fruit and fresh cut grass. 
Flavor will not disappoint. Im not going to be long winded here, if you can get this fresh, do so. This is like fresh squeezed hop juice and fruit. Top tier for the style. Juicy, grassy and just a hint of resin. Tons of bright citrus! Bitterness does not linger at all, here and gone. Just plain juicy. 
 
Good lord, my glass was gone before I could type everything I wanted! Did I say this is delicious ? It really is, no doubt. Bottle shared by Phatdog1, what a great guy!

Bottle purchased at source, thanks to Bergzilla. Cloudy amber pour into a perfect pint. Huge aroma of bright citrus, grapefruit pith and fresh cut grass. Flavor is giant resin hop bomb, fresh and clean. Great body. Abrupt finish (not a bad thing). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle dated 3/11 pours cloudy pale orange with 1 finger head. Nose is huge juicy citrusy tropical fruit, grapefruit, pineapple. Best nose of any MBC beer. Taste is dank super juicy pineapple, clementine, grapefruit, orange zest. Finish is strong bitterness, lasting tropical fruit, juciy citrus. Amazing!
